intro: Linnaea subviolascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered twinflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands, preferring acidic soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Linnaea subviolascens is noted for its delicate appearance and its role in forest ecosystems.
